Name: idea_generation_methods
Title: Idea Generation Methods: Comparing different idea generation methods for automated research paper generation.
Experiment: In this experiment, we compare the performance of different idea generation methods (perform_generate_idea()) on automated research paper generation performance. We use the review score by (perform_review()) as the evaluation metric.

Name: interdisciplinary_idea_generation
Title: Interdisciplinary Idea Generation: Leveraging Diverse Perspectives for Automated Research Paper Generation
Experiment: In this experiment, we enhance the idea generation process by incorporating interdisciplinary perspectives. We will modify the generate_ideas() function to include input from multiple academic disciplines, either through LLMs trained on diverse datasets or expert inputs. The resultant ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline domain-specific ideas. We will use semantic clustering to measure the diversity of the generated ideas.

Name: meta_learning_idea_generation
Title: Meta-Learning for Idea Generation: Enhancing Automated Research Paper Generation through Adaptive Learning
Experiment: We will enhance the generate_ideas() function by incorporating a meta-learning algorithm. This algorithm will learn from the history of generated ideas and their evaluations to adapt and improve the idea generation process. Specifically, we will use reinforcement learning techniques where the reward signal is derived from the review scores obtained via perform_review(). The framework will maintain a history log of past ideas and their respective scores. The meta-learning model will be trained on this historical data to generate new, more promising ideas.

Name: trend_aware_idea_generation
Title: Trend-Aware Idea Generation: Enhancing Automated Research Paper Generation with Trend Analysis
Experiment: We will implement a trend analysis module that scrapes recent publications from arXiv. This module will analyze the frequency of keywords and topics to identify trends, updating weekly to stay current. The generate_ideas() function will be modified to incorporate insights from the trend analysis module, influencing the generated ideas. The resultant ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline ideas that do not consider trends. We will measure the relevance and quality of the generated ideas based on review scores and their alignment with current research trends.

Name: interdisciplinary_trend_hybrid
Title: Hybrid Idea Generation: Combining Interdisciplinary Inputs and Trend Analysis for Enhanced Research Proposals
Experiment: We will enhance the generate_ideas() function by incorporating interdisciplinary inputs and trend analysis. The function will first gather diverse perspectives from multiple academic disciplines and then analyze current research trends from arXiv. The generated ideas from both components will be merged and filtered for novelty and relevance. The resultant ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline ideas. We will measure the diversity, relevance, and quality of the generated ideas based on review scores and their alignment with current research trends.

Name: user_feedback_loop_idea_generation
Title: User Feedback Loop for Idea Generation: Enhancing Automated Research Paper Generation through Real-time Feedback
Experiment: We will modify the generate_ideas() function to incorporate a feedback loop where initial ideas are presented to users for feedback. This feedback will then be used to refine and improve the generated ideas. The user feedback can be simulated using pre-defined criteria or mock feedback that mimics real expert input. The resultant ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline ideas that do not incorporate user feedback. We will measure the relevance, quality, and overall review scores of the generated ideas.

Name: adversarial_idea_generation
Title: Adversarial Idea Generation: Leveraging Adversarial Training for Enhanced Research Proposals
Experiment: We will implement an adversarial training loop within the generate_ideas() function. The generator will be a pre-trained language model fine-tuned to generate new research idea descriptions. The discriminator will be another pre-trained model that scores the generated ideas based on quality and novelty. The generator will be updated based on the feedback from the discriminator. The generated ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline ideas. Metrics such as diversity, novelty, and review scores will be used to assess the effectiveness of this method.

Name: batch_human_ai_idea_generation
Title: Batch Human-AI Collaborative Idea Generation: Leveraging Human Expertise for Enhanced Research Proposals
Experiment: We will modify the generate_ideas() function to allow for batch processing of AI-generated ideas. Human experts will review, modify, and rank these ideas in batches. The AI will then learn from this structured feedback to refine future idea generations. Specifically, we will implement an offline feedback loop where the AI generates a set of initial ideas, human experts provide input on these ideas, and the AI updates its model based on this feedback. The resultant ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline ideas generated without human input. Metrics such as relevance, quality, and review scores will be used to assess the effectiveness of this batch collaborative approach.

Name: historical_analysis_idea_generation
Title: Historical Analysis for Idea Generation: Leveraging Past Research Trends for Enhanced Research Proposals
Experiment: We will implement a module to scrape and analyze past publications from key sources like arXiv over the last 20 years. The module will identify cyclical patterns and underexplored topics within this historical data. These insights will be integrated into the generate_ideas() function to produce historically-informed ideas. The resultant ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline ideas. Metrics such as diversity, novelty, and review scores will be used to assess the effectiveness of this historical analysis approach.

Name: ensemble_idea_selection
Title: Ensemble Idea Selection: Enhancing Automated Research Paper Generation through Ensemble Learning
Experiment: We will enhance the generate_ideas() function to produce multiple sets of ideas using different generation methods. These methods could include meta-learning, trend analysis, interdisciplinary inputs, and more. We will then apply an ensemble selection mechanism, such as weighted averaging or majority voting, to select the most promising idea from the generated sets. The resultant ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline ideas generated using a single method. Metrics such as relevance, quality, novelty, and review scores will be used to assess the effectiveness of this ensemble approach.

Name: network_analysis_idea_generation
Title: Network Analysis for Idea Generation: Uncovering Research Gaps through Citation Networks
Experiment: We will enhance the generate_ideas() function by incorporating insights from citation network analysis. First, we will construct a citation network from a corpus of research papers using tools like NetworkX. Next, we will analyze the network to identify clusters, influential topics, and under-explored areas. The generate_ideas() function will be modified to integrate these insights, generating ideas that align with identified research gaps. The resultant ideas will be evaluated using the perform_review() function to compare their performance against baseline ideas. Metrics such as diversity, novelty, and review scores will be used to assess the effectiveness of this network-based approach.
